articles.author: Rupendra Brahambhatt
articles.title: Once in 5,000: CERN scientists detect two elusive God particle decays - Interesting Engineering
articles.description: New study reveals rare Higgs boson decays that could help bridge the gap between the known and the unknown in particle physics.
articles.content:
In the case of H, they looked for a small bump in the mass of the muon pair, right at 125 GeV, the known mass of the Higgs. Meanwhile, the HZ decay presented an even tougher challenge.
